snippet: Money to replenish the Highway Trust Fund is also being sought by Finance Committee leaders to help smooth the passage of a broad rewrite of the tax code.
abstract: Plan to replenish the federal Highway Trust Fund stokes conflict in Congress; Sens Harry Reid and Rand Paul are pressing for a one-time tax 'holiday' that would allow companies to deduct 85 percent of money their parent corporations in the United States receive from foreign subsidiaries, move that would bring the Treasury between $20 billion and $30 billion in the next two years; Sens Ron Wyden and Orrin G Hatch want that money to help smooth passage of a broad rewrite of the tax code.
lead_paragraph: Money to replenish the Highway Trust Fund is also being sought by Finance Committee leaders to help smooth the passage of a broad rewrite of the tax code.

headline.main: Plan to Refill Highway Fund Stokes Conflict in Congress
headline.print_headline: Plan to Refill Highway Fund Stokes Conflict in Congress
